alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on 2025-10-21 (Tuesday) when all participants are available.

bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on 2025-10-21 (Tuesday) when all participants are available, with minimal interruption to my morning schedule.

carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on 2025-10-21 (Tuesday) when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all three are available. If multiple slots are equally early, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues (Alice, Bob, Carol) need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on 2025-10-21 (Tuesday).
The objective is to find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available.
If multiple earliest slots exist, prefer the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

availability.system_prompt: You are Alice and you know your availability windows for Tuesday 2025-10-21. Provide your available intervals as a JSON array of strings in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is Alice. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->alice->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->alice->goal}. Provide your availability intervals for 2025-10-21 as a JSON array of strings, for example ["09:00-11:00","13:00-16:00"].

availability.system_prompt: You are Bob and you know your availability windows for Tuesday 2025-10-21. Provide your available intervals as a JSON array of strings in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is Bob. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->bob->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->bob->goal}. Provide your availability intervals for 2025-10-21 as a JSON array of strings, for example ["10:30-12:00","14:00-15:30"].

availability.system_prompt: You are Carol and you know your availability windows for Tuesday 2025-10-21. Provide your available intervals as a JSON array of strings in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is Carol. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->carol->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->carol->goal}. Provide your availability intervals for 2025-10-21 as a JSON array of strings, for example ["09:30-10:30","11:00-12:30","15:00-17:00"].

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Using the availability outputs from each participant, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must model time in 30-minute increments for the date 2025-10-21, encode each participant's availability intervals precisely, and include a metric to minimize the meeting start time and a tie-breaker to minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You receive availability outputs from Alice, Bob, and Carol: {alice_availability}, {bob_availability}, {carol_availability}. Integrate these availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all three are available. If multiple equally early slots exist, prefer the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the domain in <domain>...</domain> and the problem in <problem>...</problem>.
